Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to cosmetology establishments displaying resources regarding gender-based violence
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Cosmetology establishments displaying resources regarding gender-based violence.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the gender-motivated violence protection law
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to increasing access to data around gender-based violence
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to domestic violence related calls to 311
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to informational resource for newly married individuals
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Informational resource for newly married individuals.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, S.2280-A/A.4899-A, which would require law enforcement officers to conduct a lethality assessment in incidents of domestic violence.
Items.ActionName: Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
Items.MatterName: Require law enforcement officers to conduct a lethality assessment in incidents of domestic violence (S.2280-A/A.4899-A).

Items.Title: Resolution declaring New York City’s commitment to affirm and defend continued access for reproductive rights
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Declaring New York City’s commitment to affirm and defend continued access for reproductive rights.

Items.MinutesNote: Other Council Members Attending: Ung, Brooks-Powers and Public Advocate Williams
